conclusion: The state‐point B has the same volume as A (vertical line) and the same pressure as C (horizontal line).
State A: P_A = p₀, V_A = V₀, T_A = T₀
State B: P_B = 0.6 p₀, V_B = V₀
For a fixed amount of an ideal gas, PV = nRT.

premise: State A: P_A = p₀, V_A = V₀, T_A = T₀
conclusion: From state A: nR = P_A V_A / T_A = p₀ V₀ / T₀.

premise: State B: P_B = 0.6 p₀, V_B = V₀; nR = p₀ V₀ / T₀
conclusion: For state B: T_B = P_B V_B / (nR) = (0.6 p₀)(V₀) / (p₀ V₀ / T₀) = 0.6 T₀.
